channel.title: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S., Allies Hit islamic State Targets In Syria
item.description: The Pentagon says Islamic State targets in Syria were pounded using fighters, bombers and Tomahawk sea-based missiles. We examine the regional impact of the strikes on ISIS headquarters in Raqqa.
item.content:encoded:
The Pentagon says Islamic State targets in Syria were pounded using fighters, bombers and Tomahawk sea-based missiles. We examine the regional impact of the strikes on ISIS headquarters in Raqqa.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Deborah Amos

item.title: As U.N. Leaders Prepare To Meet, Many Issues Vie For Attention
item.description: Multiple crises could be difficult for diplomats to make priorities with so many key issues at stake: the Ebola crisis, terrorism in the Middle East and the war in Ukraine — just to name a few.
item.content:encoded:
Multiple crises could be difficult for diplomats to make priorities with so many key issues at stake: the Ebola crisis, terrorism in the Middle East and the war in Ukraine — just to name a few.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: Islamic State Targets Hit In Syria, Pentagon Says
item.description: The U.S. and its allies expanded the assault against the Islamic State. The Pentagon says targets inside Syria were hit for the first time. The attacks are focused on ISIS assets around Raqqa.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. and its allies expanded the assault against the Islamic State. The Pentagon says targets inside Syria were hit for the first time. The attacks are focused on ISIS assets around Raqqa.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: Treasury Announces Steps To Reduce Corporate Tax Dodges
item.description: They're meant to discourage tax inversions by U.S. corporations. Inversions take place when a company merges with a foreign partner and re-incorporates overseas as a way to avoid U.S. taxes.
item.content:encoded:
They're meant to discourage tax inversions by U.S. corporations. Inversions take place when a company merges with a foreign partner and re-incorporates overseas as a way to avoid U.S. taxes.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Jim Zarroli

item.title: Yemen Appears To Be On The Brink Of Sectarian War
item.description: Even after a deal was reached to create a new government, fighting raged between the rebels and Sunni militants. Audie Cornish talks to Iona Craig, who is reporting from Sanaa for The Times of London.
item.content:encoded:
Even after a deal was reached to create a new government, fighting raged between the rebels and Sunni militants. Audie Cornish talks to Iona Craig, who is reporting from Sanaa for The Times of London.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Ebola's Toll: Farmers Aren't Farming, Traders Aren't Trading
item.description: Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone were just starting to see economic progress after years of conflict. The blow of Ebola, says the World Bank, could be "catastrophic."
item.content:encoded:
Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone were just starting to see economic progress after years of conflict. The blow of Ebola, says the World Bank, could be "catastrophic."

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Germany's New Economy Minister Takes Aim At Arms Exports
item.description: The nation is the world's third-largest arms exporter, and many weapons go to countries with questionable human rights records. Sigmar Gabriel wants to change that — but not all Germans are on board.
item.content:encoded:
The nation is the world's third-largest arms exporter, and many weapons go to countries with questionable human rights records. Sigmar Gabriel wants to change that — but not all Germans are on board.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Soraya Sarhaddi Nelson

item.title: U.S., Allies Hit Islamic State Targets In Syria, Pentagon Says
item.description: The Pentagon said it had used fighter, bomber and Tomahawk missiles during the mission launched on Monday.
item.content:encoded:
The Pentagon said it had used fighter, bomber and Tomahawk missiles during the mission launched on Monday.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Calderon: End Fossil Fuel Subsidies, Create Carbon Tax
item.description: Former Mexican President Felipe Calderon lead a group to encourage heads of state to propel climate change. He discusses the obstacles that block aggressive efforts to curb climate change.
item.content:encoded:
Former Mexican President Felipe Calderon lead a group to encourage heads of state to propel climate change. He discusses the obstacles that block aggressive efforts to curb climate change.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Robert Siegel

item.title: What's Turkey's Next Step In Fight Against ISIS?
item.description: Turkey recently secured the release of 49 ISIS hostages. John Kerry said that Ankara had not committed to the coalition against ISIS because they first needed to deal with that hostage situation.
item.content:encoded:
Turkey recently secured the release of 49 ISIS hostages. John Kerry said that Ankara had not committed to the coalition against ISIS because they first needed to deal with that hostage situation.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Robert Siegel

item.title: Why A Teenage Mom Was Jailed In El Salvador After A Stillbirth
item.description: Christina Quintanilla faced up to 50 years in prison after an anonymous hospital worker accused her of having an abortion.
item.content:encoded:
Christina Quintanilla faced up to 50 years in prison after an anonymous hospital worker accused her of having an abortion.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Jason Beaubien

item.title: Thousands March In Russia To Protest Involvement In Ukraine
item.description: A peace march in central Moscow on Sunday drew more than 25,000 protesters, objecting to the Russian government's actions in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
A peace march in central Moscow on Sunday drew more than 25,000 protesters, objecting to the Russian government's actions in Ukraine.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Corey Flintoff

item.title: Kurdish Refugees Join Huge Numbers Of Displaced Syrians
item.description: The Syrian refugee flood in southern Turkey this weekend is just the latest in a larger crisis in the region. NPR's Melissa Block and Robert Siegel go over the numbers.
item.content:encoded:
The Syrian refugee flood in southern Turkey this weekend is just the latest in a larger crisis in the region. NPR's Melissa Block and Robert Siegel go over the numbers.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Melissa Block

item.title: India's Orbiter To Join NASA's Maven Around Mars – On A Shoestring
item.description: India's Mars Orbiter Mission is set to reach Mars on Wednesday, just days after a U.S. NASA probe began its orbit around the Red Planet. The difference? India did it on a much tighter budget.
item.content:encoded:
India's Mars Orbiter Mission is set to reach Mars on Wednesday, just days after a U.S. NASA probe began its orbit around the Red Planet. The difference? India did it on a much tighter budget.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Julie McCarthy

item.title: Tensions Rise As Syrian Kurds Flee ISIS Advance
item.description: The Islamic State recently launched an offensive that sent a wave of Kurdish refugees into Turkey from Syria. Deborah Amos reports from southern Turkey on the chaos on the border.
item.content:encoded:
The Islamic State recently launched an offensive that sent a wave of Kurdish refugees into Turkey from Syria. Deborah Amos reports from southern Turkey on the chaos on the border.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Deb Amos
